pullrequest.title: Better chunk metadata for gaps in telomeric regions and between supercontigs

content.raw:
The `mask_present` is essentially a boolean "present" | "not present" numpy array. `argmax` gives the index of the maximum value. In the case of ties (which there will be) `argmax` returns the first index with the maximum value.
I believe this is the recommended (and fastest?) way of finding the first occurrence of a value in numpy as far as I know. I could not find a better way of doing this.

I did comment on this specific behavior on Line 182 but it was not mentioned here. I could replicate the comment here if necessary.
